## Summary

Focused PR addressing only the **4 essential fixes** that resolve real-world breakages in the install script. This minimizes production risk while fixing actual issues users encounter.

### Essential Fixes Applied ‚úÖ

1. **üêü Fish Shell PATH Fix** - Fixes broken PATH updates in Fish shell
   - Changed from `set --export PATH` to `set -gx PATH` for proper Fish shell compatibility

2. **üîí Safer Uninstall** - Prevents accidental symlink deletion  
   - Only removes symlinks that explicitly point to our managed install path (`$FVM_DIR_BIN/fvm`)
   - Warns when skipping unrelated symlinks, preventing deletion of user's custom symlinks

3. **üìÅ Auto-create /usr/local/bin** - Removes common friction point
   - Automatically creates the symlink directory using privilege escalation (`sudo`/`doas`) instead of erroring
   - Eliminates the manual step that often confuses users

4. **‚ö° Ensure Binary Executability** - Guarantees binary can run
   - Added `chmod +x` after extraction to ensure binary has execute permissions
   - Handles tarballs that don't preserve execute permissions during extraction

### Production Impact üéØ

- **Zero breaking changes** to existing fvm CLI or install script usage
- **Minimal change surface** - only addresses actual breakages reported by users
- **Backward compatible** - all existing workflows continue to work unchanged
- **Risk minimized** - avoids speculative improvements that could introduce regressions

### Test Plan ‚úÖ

- [x] Shellcheck validation passes cleanly
- [x] Basic functionality (`--help`, `--version`) works correctly
- [x] All existing CI tests remain unchanged and passing
- [x] Focused scope ensures no unintended side effects

This approach prioritizes production stability while fixing the core issues that actually impact users in the real world.
